intro: Calandrinia caespitosa var. australis, commonly known as the Australian moss rose, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and produces clusters of showy, pink to red flowers. The plant features small, ovate leaves that are covered in fine hairs, and its stems are often succulent. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. This variety is closely related to other species in the Portulacaceae family, sharing similar botanical traits.
